page.title: 06WEST VALE AREA
page.content: Three points of interst about West Vale are Clayhouse, North Dean Wood and Calderdale Way. Clayhouse is a fine 17th century house with aisled barn, once owned by the Clay family and now headquarters of Calderdale Museum Service. There is a room of information for the North Dean Nature Trail which starts and finishes here. The wood is dominated by oak and birch trees. North Dean Wood Charity appears in records in 1757 applying profits from wood sales to help local poor. The warden of the trail and nature reserve is based at Clayhouse. He organises guided walks and a young people's weekly nature group. The Calderdale Way starts and finishes at Clayhouse. It was established in 1974, first major recreation path in Britain, 50 miles long. It stretches throughout Calderdale.
